intro: Trillium grandiflorum f. regressum, commonly known as the small-flowered white trillium, is a rare and distinctive variant of the white trillium. It is characterized by its smaller, more delicate flowers compared to the typical form, with three white petals and three green sepals. This plant is native to eastern North America and thrives in shaded, moist woodlands. It has a short stem with a single leaf and is often found in rich, loamy soil. The botanical features of this form highlight its adaptation to woodland ecosystems and its ecological significance as a native wildflower.
